intro: Gemellaria, commonly known as the twin-leaf or twin-leaf fern, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves that resemble a pair of leaves joined at the base. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Gemellaria species are known for their small, clustered flowers that can be pink, white, or purple in color. These plants are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique foliage and delicate blossoms.
